title: Electric energy - charge released near two charges

content.question: Which graph best represents the particleâ€™s speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"> <mi>v</mi> </math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> as the particle moves along the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"> <mi>y</mi> </math>-axis?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply for a distance and then more gradually again, and it ends above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the near the top of the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply for a distance and then more gradually again, and it levels off on the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, reaches a peak, and then moves downward and to the right and ends at the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins near top of the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right, reaches a trough slightly above the horizontal axis, and then moves upward and to the right and ends high above the end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply for a distance and then more gradually again, and it ends above the end of the horizontal axis.
